questions.subject: ComfyQR-scanning-nodes
questions.question: What is the purpose of the ComfyQR-scanning-nodes project?
questions.answer: The project provides ComfyUI nodes to quickly test generated QR codes for scannability.

questions.subject: ComfyQR-scanning-nodes
questions.question: Where can I find the source code for ComfyQR-scanning-nodes?
questions.answer: The project is managed publicly on Gitlab (https://gitlab.com/sofuego-comfy-nodes/ComfyQR-scanning-nodes) but is also mirrored on Github (https://github.com/coreyryanhanson/ComfyQR-scanning-nodes).

questions.subject: Read QR Code node
questions.question: What is the function of the Read QR Code node?
questions.answer: The node extracts text data from a QR code using the pyzbar library.

questions.subject: Validate QR Code node
questions.question: What is the purpose of the Validate QR Code node?
questions.answer: The node checks whether text extracted from a QR code is valid and matches the specified text.

questions.subject: Validate QR Code node
questions.question: What are the inputs required for the Validate QR Code node?
questions.answer: The node requires the image layer, the extracted text from the Read QR Code node, the protocol and the text of the QR code.

questions.subject: Accuracy in readability
questions.question: Why is pyzbar chosen as the QR reader library?
questions.answer: Pyzbar is chosen for its low dependencies, regular updates, and popularity.

questions.subject: Accuracy in readability
questions.question: How can the accuracy of QR code readability be improved?
questions.answer: Adding a Pad Image for Outpainting node before sending the image to Read QR Code can help to reduce false negatives when the border size of a QR code is small.
